title: Contributory Aged Parent visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Contributory Aged Parent visa (subclass 864), a permanent visa for aged parents of settled Australian citizens, permanent residents, or eligible New Zealand citizens. It explains eligibility, costs, processing times, travel rights, family inclusion, and how the application process works. It also highlights upcoming changes to ImmiAccount services for parent visa applicants.

structured_data.description: This permanent visa lets the aged parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen stay in Australia.

important_updates.additional_applicable: Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported

notes: Travel to and from Australia unlimited times within 5 years
After 5 years, a Resident Return Visa (RRV) is required for re-entry
Citizenship removes visa need for re-entry

requirements: Must have an eligible child who is a settled Australian citizen, permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen
Must be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia
Must not have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (subclass 870) visa

processing_times.general_statement: Demand for Parent visas exceeds available places, resulting in lengthy processing times.
processing_times.processing_order: Applications processed in order received, subject to capping and queueing

application_process.apply_from: Must be in Australia (not in immigration clearance) when applying
application_process.family_member_location_rule: Family members applying with you must also be in Australia, not in immigration clearance
two_stage_assessment: Initial assessment for eligibility and queue placement or refusal
Final assessment when a place becomes available
important_notes: Do not arrange to stay permanently until visa is granted
Decision will be provided in writing

requirements: Must include details of all family members (migrating or not)
Migrating family members must meet health and character requirements
Non-migrating family members may also need to meet health and character requirements

additional_information.help_with_visa: Applicants should check information about who can help with visa applications before paying for assistance.

subclass_884_pathway.description: Applicants may apply for the subclass 864 visa after holding the Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) (subclass 884) visa.
benefits: Balance of family test already met

alternative_visas.notes: First step before 864; 2-step process is faster but costlier than subclass 804 or applying directly for subclass 864.
Temporary visa allowing parents to visit their children for 3 or 5 years at a time, up to 10 years total.

obligations.note: Content truncated; general obligations apply to visa holders and their family members.
